neighbors.name: Municipal Authority of the Borough of Minersville
neighbors.claims: The Municipal Authority of the Borough of Minersville was incorporated in 1941 to manage local water services ([source](https://www.waterworkshistory.us/PA/Minersville/)). The Authority is actively engaged in renewable energy development discussions; as of August 2021, the board reviewed a proposal from Everett Jones Investments, LLC to lease and develop 1,500 acres of Authority property for a large solar project ([source](https://minersvillepa.gov/document/water-authority-minutes-16-august-2021/)). By February 2025, meeting minutes indicated that permitting with the Fish and Boat Commission was complete and Cass Township zoning was secured for solar use, though interconnection queue delays were noted ([source](https://minersvillepa.gov/document/water-authority-minutes-17-february-2025/)). The Authority currently receives annual lease revenue for a windmill operated by Green Energy ([source](https://minersvillepa.gov/document/water-authority-minutes-17-february-2025/)). Additionally, PENNVEST funding applications for 2022 included the installation of solar panels to reduce energy demand at Authority facilities ([source](https://files.dep.state.pa.us/water/bpnpsm/InfrastructureFinance/StateRevolvFundIntendUsePlan/2022/2022_DWSRF_IUP_Attachment_6-Project_Application_Sources_and_Uses_Charts.pdf)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via Board Solicitor Albert Evans or Manager Melanie Spittler; reference ongoing 1,500-acre solar lease negotiations with Everett Jones Investments.

neighbors.name: Schuylkill Economic Development Corporation (SEDCO)
neighbors.claims: SEDCO exists to "stimulate and influence the process of economic development" in Schuylkill County ([source](https://www.sed-co.com/about-sedco/)). State Senator David Argall has called SEDCO a "tireless partner" in bringing new jobs and opportunities to the county ([source](https://www.senatorargall.com/2024/07/23/state-grant-supports-careers-employers-in-western-schuylkill-county/)). The organization manages Highridge Business Park, where it installed a wind turbine to power entrance lighting ([source](http://www.controlaltenergy.com/)). In 2025, the organization was listed in the state Capital Budget Project Itemization Act for a $10 million allocation toward industrial park development including "solar energy or other alternative green energy sources" ([source](https://www.pa.gov/content/dam/copapwp-pagov/en/budget/documents/programs-and-services/racp/racp-project-awards-itemizations/project%20authorizations-website.xlsx)). SEDCO President Frank Zukas has publicly testified regarding the tax revenue benefits of industrial and renewable energy projects ([source](https://shensentinel.com/news/mahanoy-township-hears-feedback-and-pushback-as-it-considers-zoning-amendment-courts-two-warehouse-developers/)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with President Frank Zukas; leverage their existing $10M RACP allocation for green energy industrial park development.
